generif.text: MHC class II-mediated signals induced by the natural ligand, LAG-3, lead to complete maturation of monocyte-derived dendritic cells, which acquire the capacity to trigger naive T cells and drive polarized Th1 responses.

LAG-3 induces rapid protein phosphorylation of phospholipase Cgamma2 and p72syk as well as activation of phosphatidyl inositol 3-kinase/Akt, p42/44 extracellular signal-regulated protein kinase, and p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase pathways.

LAG-3 activates antigen-presenting cells through MHC class II signalling, leading to increased antigen-specific T-cell responses in vivo.

LAG-3+ CD4+ T cells exhibit a regulatory cell phenotype and negatively associate with the HCV nAb response, implying that LAG-3 may be involved in the negative regulation of humoral immunity during HCV infection.

name: lymphocyte activating 3

wikipathways.name: SARS-CoV-2 innate immunity evasion and cell-specific immune response

summary: Lymphocyte-activation protein 3 belongs to Ig superfamily and contains 4 extracellular Ig-like domains. The LAG3 gene contains 8 exons.  The sequence data, exon/intron organization, and chromosomal localization all indicate a close relationship of LAG3 to CD4. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
